value.0: Still pondering what to do about Yakir, are you, <FirstName>?
Greetings and congratulations, <FirstName>! Today we become full citizens. It's really quite exciting, don't you think? I know a little about this Yakir fellow, if you're interested.

My folks? Well... I don't remember much. They passed on when I was very young. I was only eight or so when the Academy took me in. I know my acceptance was an act of pity but it gave me more hope than I would have found on the streets.

My parents died during a winter blizzard. A band of brigands had come upon our home in the forest and my father's conscience wouldn't let them freeze in the snow. He unbarred the door and invited them in.
My father was a warm-hearted man. He gave the three travelers food and a warm spot by the fire to wait out the winter storm. In less then a hour they had revealed their true nature.
Mother sent me through the blizzard to the Academy. She said I was to return with help but that was just a facade. She just wanted to ensure that I escaped the carnage she knew was coming.
By the time I reached the Academy, the deed was done. The Imperial Guard investigated the scene and I was made a ward of the Empire, then of the Academy itself.
This is a sad tale, however. Do you have something else we can talk about?

They're here in spirit. <StartAction>[The gnome smiles warmly at the thought.]</Start> I think that they would be very proud with all I've learned here... Gosh, it's been so long since I was orphaned to the Academy, hasn't it?
I'm sure they would be very proud, Janthos. You've accomplished much during your time here... Excluding, of course, those mechanized monsters you have strolling the courtyards.
It's always about my golems, isn't it Alia? <StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start> Where is your father, <FirstName>? I'd have expected he'd be here today.
Hey! No need for hostilities, <FirstName>. I'm sure he'll be along before the closing of the ceremony.
I trust he will make it. He cares for you greatly but bears a substantial burden as the community's Magistrate. You should try to understand his position as well as your own.
The title of Magistrate is a heavy burden on even the strongest men. However, I seriously doubt your father would miss this. Keep your eyes open; I'm sure he'll be here shortly.
I'm sure he will. I'm surprised he's not here already, to be honest. I can't count the number of time he's stopped by the Academy to discuss your progress with the instructors.
I'm sure Janthos is right. Your father's offices are near enough; I'm sure he'll be here before the ceremony ends.
Is there anything else you'd like to know?

<StartAction>[The gnome chuckles wryly.]</Start> I know you're trying to buy time until your father arrives but this is hardly the time or the place to be swapping well-worn stories with each other. After the ceremony, maybe. I'll be out in the courtyard.
Working on your mechanical monstrosities, I have no doubt. Must your projects always be so unnatural and dangerous, Janthos?
Druids... This feat of engineering is a true testament to my... uh... Actually, what was I saying about well-worn stories? I'll show you what I mean out in the courtyard later, okay <FirstName>?

Some called him the "Black Butcher" but others call him much worse. He was a small-time sorcerer until two years ago. One afternoon he started hurling fireballs and summoning demons in the city streets.
In his short but bloody rampage he killed over a hundred and twenty people. Most were women and children. After the guard sealed his power, he was tried and summarily executed for his crimes.

A truly awful sort. I'm glad to see he's still being held under Rakha's power and, if you ask me, that's where he should stay! Rakha will make him pay for his crimes more thoroughly than hell ever could.
Well that seems a little harsh!

Murder is a pretty harsh thing, Alia. Especially a hundred murders! I have no pity for those who kill for sport... But enough talk of dark deeds. It makes my skin crawl. Is there anything else you'd like to know, <FirstName>?

You know how I feel about this, <FirstName>. Yakir's a rebel and a criminal of the most despicable sort. He should be caged and confined, with every right and freedom stripped from him forever. I say we leave him in Rakha's keeping.
What was that all about!? You let the spirit go and insulted the academy! Why do you insist on being so arrogant, <FirstName>?
You should not insult one who has given us so much. It is not my place to berate you for your foolishness but, rest assured, your father will hear of this.
Well, it seems you've made your decision. The spirit is free. I don't agree with your Judgement but Yakir's fate was yours to decide, not mine.
I... I understand your point. He will surely suffer an eternity for what he has done. I still feel that he deserves worse than what Hell has to offer, though...
So that was the Judgement. I'd like to thank you, <FirstName>. I'm sure that more good will come by leaving the spirit in Rakha's care than by setting it free.
I agree wholeheartedly. The victims of Yakir's vile actions can rest easy tonight. Thanks again, <FirstName>.
Excuse me.
What happened to your parents, anyway?
It's a shame your parents can't be here.
Mind your own business, gnome!
My father cares nothing for me.
My father is a busy man. I doubt he'll make it.
Gilles said he'd be here shortly.
Tell me about yourself.
Tell me about Yakir the Black.
What Judgement would you cast, Janthos?
I will not stand for Rakha's audacity.
Yakir's spirit will suffer in Hell where evil belongs.
Yakir deserved a punishment that was truly eternal.
